definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort

sentences.english: On the screen flashes three types of pictures.
sentences.chinese: 在屏幕上轮番放着三种类型的图片。

sentences.english: That limited the rate of fire would very limited even with rotation.
sentences.chinese: 即使枪手们轮番上阵，所能节省的时间也非常有限。

sentences.english: The stability of the economy and society would surely be affected, leaving people haunted.
sentences.chinese: 轮番提价势必影响经济和社会稳定，搞得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: But it too eventually succumbed to record industry attacks.
sentences.chinese: 但最终也没能挺过唱片行业的轮番攻击。

sentences.english: The surprise and shock, rinse and Fang Zhai is staged by dreams and nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 这种惊喜和惊吓，是漱芳斋轮番上演的美梦和恶梦。

sentences.english: We took turns stoking the furnaces.
Raising price again and again should affect economy and social stability, and make people nervous.
sentences.chinese: 轮番提价势必影响经济和社会稳定，搞得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: Air strikes, artillery and tanks have been used.
sentences.chinese: 空袭，大炮和坦克轮番上阵。

sentences.english: School means seven classes with seven different teachers.
sentences.chinese: 在学校你每天要上七节课，常常七个老师轮番上阵。

sentences.english: Son-in-law of the new home, her relatives and family room turns wine before dinner.
sentences.chinese: 新女婿上门后，娘家房族亲戚轮番摆宴请酒。

sentences.english: After everybody tested him several times, he finally showed his true colours.
sentences.chinese: 经过大家轮番地考验，他终于原形毕露。

sentences.english: As you alternate eyes, your finger will seem to change position.
sentences.chinese: 当你轮番睁闭眼时，你的指头似乎是变换了位置。

sentences.english: She was no longer the alternate succubus .
sentences.chinese: 她不再是那个轮番变幻的魔女了。

definition: up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
to enumerate in detail/to explain clearly
to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
